title: Ceasefire In Israel Fizzles
teaser: After briefly agreeing to a deal brokered by Egypt, Israel's airstrikes restarted when Hamas continued to attack Israel with rocket fire.
contentencoded:
Earlier this morning, Israel agreed to a ceasefire deal outlined by Egypt. But Hamas, whose officials say they were not consulted on the proposal, continued to attack Israel with rocket fire.

In retaliation, Israel’s airstrikes on Gaza have restarted. Daniel Estrin is reporting for NPR in Jerusalem and joins Here & Now’s Meghna Chakrabarti to discuss the latest developments.

Guest

  • Daniel Estrin, Middle East-based journalist, currently in Jerusalem. He tweets @DanielEstrin.
